metadata.Title: CVE-2011-2516 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
Off-by-one error in the XML signature feature in Apache XML Security forC++ 1.6.0, as used in Shibboleth before 2.4.3 and possibly other products,allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via asignature using a large RSA key, which triggers a buffer overflow.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2011-2516` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxml-security-c17v5 - 1.6.1-1
xml-security-c-utils - 1.6.1-1
No subscription required

libapache2-mod-shib2 - 2.5.2+dfsg-2
libshibsp-plugins - 2.5.2+dfsg-2
libshibsp6 - 2.5.2+dfsg-2
shibboleth-sp2-common - 2.5.2+dfsg-2
shibboleth-sp2-schemas - 2.5.2+dfsg-2
shibboleth-sp2-utils - 2.5.2+dfsg-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: xml-security-c package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.6.1-1').
shibboleth-sp2 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.5.2+dfsg-2').
